definition: white paper (e.g. containing proposals for new legislation)/white book

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In the seventh part, the white paper stresses the importance of the "Popularization and Education of the Law."
sentences.chinese: 白皮書第七章強調了法律普及和法制教育的重要性。

sentences.english: The writer writes the white book quite quietly in quilt.
sentences.chinese: 作家在被子裏十分平靜地寫白皮書。

sentences.english: Guards also sexually abused female prisoners according to the white paper.
sentences.chinese: 根據白皮書所說，監獄衛兵還對女犯人進行性侵犯。

sentences.english: That white person will ride home on a cloud.
All the Chinese White Papers on National Defense have emphasized this principle.
sentences.chinese: 所有的中國國防白皮書都着重於這一原則。

sentences.english: His financial white paper gets much right.
sentences.chinese: 他的金融白皮書有很多對症下藥之處。

sentences.english: There are also a number of additional resources listed in the whitepaper.
sentences.chinese: 白皮書中還包含了大量其他的資源。

sentences.english: China’s new defence “white paper” is aimed at dispelling such concerns.
sentences.chinese: 中國的最新國防“白皮書”旨在打消這種顧慮。

sentences.english: The author writes the white book very noiselessly in quilt.
sentences.chinese: 作傢在被子裏十分平靜地寫白皮書。

sentences.english: The whitepaper explains several details of the phaser concept.
sentences.chinese: 這份白皮書較爲詳盡地解釋了phaser的概念。

sentences.english: JPC has published annual white paper on leisure since 1977.
sentences.chinese: 日本生產性本部從1977年起每年推出該白皮書。

sentences.english: It took a village to create a whitepaper.
sentences.chinese: 寫一份白皮書要全村人齊上陣。

sentences.english: The whitepaper was available at the time I visited it without any registration.
sentences.chinese: 這份白皮書在我訪問的時候是不需要註冊賬號的。

sentences.english: They also published a white paper about their approach.
sentences.chinese: 他們對他們的方法同時出版了白皮書。

sentences.english: The report states up front that science can change lives.
sentences.chinese: 這份白皮書開宗明義地指出了科學可以改變生活”。

sentences.english: I took a task of writing a white paper about designing a game engine.
sentences.chinese: 朕採取了寫一本關於設計的遊戲引擎白皮書的任務。

definition: to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
to weave/to plait/to compile/to put together (a lesson plan, budget etc)
three items/three events/three terms/tri-/trinomial, ternary (math.)/triathlon (abbr. for 三項全能|三项全能)
to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
